content.question: In the later twentieth century, the development of birth control and family planning techniques encouraged the growth of the feminist movement primarily by

choices.label: making the goals of the movement more attainable by giving women greater control over reproductive decisions
encouraging women to reject the introduction of technology into the natural process of childbearing
encouraging women to marry earlier without fear of being obliged to care for children at a young age
shifting more of the responsibility for birth control decisions to husbands and male partners

content.answer: making the goals of the movement more attainable by giving women greater control over reproductive decisions

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
